Package cycling

Class Stage

  • java.lang.Object
    • cycling.Stage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Stage
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Stage encapsulates race stages, each of which has a number of associated Segments.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Stage

        public Stage​(java.lang.String name,
             java.lang.String description,
             double length,
             java.time.LocalDateTime startTime,
             StageType type)
      throws IllegalNameException,
             InvalidNameException,
             InvalidLengthException
        Stage constructor; creates a new stage and adds to allStages array.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new stage
        description - The description of the new stage
        length - The total length of the new stage
        startTime - The start time for the new stage
        type - The type of the new stage
        Throws:
        IllegalNameException - If name already exists in the system
        InvalidNameException - If name is empty/null, contains whitespace, or is longer than 30 characters
        InvalidLengthException - If the length is less than 5km

      • addSegmentToStage

        public int addSegmentToStage​(double location,
                             SegmentType type,
                             double averageGradient,
                             double length)
                      throws InvalidLocationException,
                             InvalidStageStateException,
                             InvalidStageTypeException
        Creates a new stage and adds the ID to the stageIds array.
        Parameters:
        location - The location of the new segment
        type - The type of the new segment
        averageGradient - The average gradient of the new segment
        length - The length (in km) of the new segment
        Throws:
        InvalidLocationException - If the segment finishes outside of the bounds of the stage
        InvalidStageStateException - If the segment state is waiting for results
        InvalidStageTypeException - If the stage type is a time-trial (cannot contain segments)

      • addSegmentToStage

        public static int addSegmentToStage​(int id,
                                    double location,
                                    SegmentType type,
                                    double averageGradient,
                                    double length)
                             throws IDNotRecognisedException,
                                    InvalidLocationException,
                                    InvalidStageStateException,
                                    InvalidStageTypeException
        Creates a new stage and adds the ID to the stageIds array.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the stage to which the segment will be added
        location - The location of the new segment
        type - The type of the new segment
        averageGradient - The average gradient of the new segment
        length - The length (in km) of the new segment
        Throws:
        IDNotRecognisedException - If no stage exists with the requested ID
        InvalidLocationException - If the segment finishes outside of the bounds of the stage
        InvalidStageStateException - If the segment state is waiting for results
        InvalidStageTypeException - If the stage type is a time-trial (cannot contain segments)

      • removeSegmentFromStage

        public static void removeSegmentFromStage​(int id,
                                          int segmentId)
                                   throws IDNotRecognisedException
        Removes a segmentId from the array of segmentIds for a stage instance, as well as from the static array of all segments in the Segment class.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the stage to which the segment will be removed
        segmentId - The ID of the segment to be removed
        Throws:
        IDNotRecognisedException - If no segment exists with the requested ID

      • removeSegment

        public static void removeSegment​(int segmentId)
                          throws IDNotRecognisedException
        Removes a segmentId from the array of segmentIds for a stage instance, as well as from the static array of all segments in the Segment class.
        Parameters:
        segmentId - The ID of the segment to be removed
        Throws:
        IDNotRecognisedException - If no segment exists with the requested ID
